law.text: There is hereby created and established in Miami-Dade County an advisory task force to be known as the Miami-Dade County STS Oversight Task Force (STS Task Force).

The STS Task Force shall be composed of nine members as follows:
One (1) member of the Board of County Commissioners appointed by the Commission who shall serve as the Chairperson of the STS Task Force;
Four (4) STS users appointed by the Committee on Disability Issues; and
Four (4) representatives from the providers of STS services appointed by the Commission.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the STS Task Force shall, upon creation, be composed of those individuals appointed to serve on the STS Oversight Task Force pursuant to Resolution 133-02.

All members shall serve for two years and may be reappointed thereafter for successive two-year terms. Members may be removed in accordance with the provisions of Section 2-11.39 of the Code of Miami-Dade County. Vacancies on the Task Force shall be filled in the same manner by which Task Force members were appointed.

The STS Task Force shall select a Vice-chairperson. A majority of the members shall constitute a quorum. The STS Task Force shall adopt a regular schedule of meetings. All meetings of the STS Task Force shall be public and written minutes shall be maintained.
The County Manager shall provide adequate departmental staff support and access to necessary resources to enable the STS Task Force to carry out its duties and functions.
